intro: Vandenboschia exsecta, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a striking flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that resemble tulips. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and produces bright orange to red flowers in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
